subSections.title: Etymology
subSections.text:
Area word (rice culture originated in the south). Often compared with {{cog|hmx-pro|*mbləu||rice plant/paddy}}, whence {{cog|mww|nplej}} ({{zh-ref|Bodman, 1980}}).

The relationship with similar-looking Mon-Khmer words is ambiguous ({{zh-ref|Schuessler, 2007}}). {{zh-ref|Ferlus (2010)}} proposes a connection between {{cog|och|-}} {{och-l|稻}} and {{cog|mkh-pro|*sruʔ||paddy}}, which in turn is linked to {{cog|mkh-pro|*t₂rawʔ||taro}}, as the two plants share the same farming niche.

The native Min word {{zh-l|*粙}} may be a variant ({{zh-ref|Schuessler, 2007}}, ''apud'' {{w|Jerry Norman (sinologist)|Norman}}, [[p.c.]]).
